newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Australian wool indicator falls 4c to 607c/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Australian wool indicator falls 4c to 607c/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market's eastern indicator fell 4.0 cents to 607 cents a kg clean at auctions in Sydney on Wednesday, reflecting a weaker tone in merino fleece, Wool International (WI) said.
In merinos, the fine 19 micron indicator was unchanged but 20m was up to 1.0 percent cheaper, 21m 1.0 percent cheaper, 22/23/25/26m 0.5 percent cheaper and 24m slightly cheaper, WI said.
In merino skirtings, 20/21/22m were slightly cheaper.
In crossbreds, 27 to 31m were unchanged on a nominal basis.
In cardings, washing locks were 2.0 percent dearer, while light carbonising locks and crutchings were unchanged.
Japanese interests provided principal competition with good support from most sectors of the trade, WI said.
Of the 7,238 bales offered, 10.0 percent were passed in.
Sales continue Thursday in Sydney and Fremantle with about 25,000 bales on offer.
